intro: Kibara tomentosa, commonly known as the woolly kibara, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in a dense layer of white, woolly hairs, which give it its common name. The flowers are usually pale yellow or white, and the plant produces small, round fruits that contain a single seed.
